description: From Latin ēvapōrātus, perfect passive participle of ēvapōrō (“evaporate”).

verbs.description: evaporate (third-person singular simple present evaporates, present participle evaporating, simple past and past participle evaporated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) to transition from a liquid state into a gaseous state
(transitive) to expel moisture from (usually by means of artificial heat), leaving the solid portion
(transitive, figuratively) to give vent to; to dissipate
examples: My lord of Essex evaporated his thoughts in a sonnet.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, figuratively) to disappear; to escape or pass off without effect
